github_commits.author: Rahul Sharma
github_commits.message: Initial architecture setup - Spring Boot, RabbitMQ, MongoDB integration
github_commits.lessons_learned: Need to revisit RabbitMQ configuration for better error handling.  Implement aggressive retry logic is crucial.
github_commits.bug_related: This commit directly addresses the need for Implement aggressive retry logic to handle potential RabbitMQ connection failures.

github_commits.author: Priya Sharma
github_commits.message: Added basic Angular components for UI
github_commits.lessons_learned: UI needs more styling.  Let's add some basic styles.
github_commits.bug_related: Not directly related, but good to ensure UI responsiveness.

messages.author: Rahul
messages.text: Yaar, Initial architecture pe kaam karna hai.  Amit, tu dekh raha kya?

messages.author: Priya
messages.text: Haan bhai, main dekh rahi hoon.  UI components bhi bana rahi hoon.

messages.author: Amit
messages.text: Theek hai, let me check the code and see how we can integrate it with RabbitMQ.  Arrey, ye production mein aayega kya, if we don't handle errors properly?

messages.author: Neha
messages.text: Arrey, ye issue production mein aayega kya?  Agar RabbitMQ connection fail ho toh kya hoga?  Implement aggressive retry logic is important!

messages.author: Rahul
messages.text: Nahi yaar, testing mein catch kar lenge.  Let's build a robust retry mechanism.  Arrey, Amit, tu dekhna hai.

slack_conversations.key_decisions: Decided to prioritize Spring Boot, RabbitMQ, and MongoDB integration for the initial architecture.
slack_conversations.warnings: Warning: Need to implement robust error handling and a retry mechanism for RabbitMQ connections.  Implement aggressive retry logic is critical for stability.
slack_conversations.bug_clues: Neha's question about potential production issues highlights the need for a robust retry strategy.  Implement aggressive retry logic is key.

jira_tickets.title: Implement Initial architecture - Spring Boot, RabbitMQ, MongoDB
jira_tickets.description: Detailed description of Initial architecture work: Setting up Spring Boot application, integrating with RabbitMQ for message queuing, and using MongoDB for data persistence.  Focus on building a scalable and resilient system. Implement aggressive retry logic is a priority.
comments: Update 1: Initial Spring Boot project created.
Update 2: RabbitMQ configuration completed - Implement aggressive retry logic is being investigated.
jira_tickets.bug_connection: Directly related to the need to implement Implement aggressive retry logic to handle potential RabbitMQ connection failures and ensure system resilience.

confluence_docs.title: Initial Architecture - Spring Boot, RabbitMQ, MongoDB
confluence_docs.content: Markdown content about Initial architecture: Overview of the chosen technologies (Spring Boot, RabbitMQ, MongoDB), design decisions, and initial implementation steps.  Emphasize the importance of Implement aggressive retry logic for RabbitMQ integration.  Best practices for Spring Boot development are also included.
confluence_docs.author: Sneha Patel
common_mistakes: Ignoring error handling in RabbitMQ connections - Implement aggressive retry logic is crucial to avoid data loss.

google_docs.title: Sprint 1 Planning - Initial Architecture
google_docs.content: Meeting notes about Initial architecture: Key discussion points, action items, and decisions made during the sprint planning meeting.  We decided to prioritize the Spring Boot, RabbitMQ, and MongoDB integration. Implement aggressive retry logic is a key takeaway.
action_items: Priya: Start working on the UI components.
decisions_made: Decided to use Spring Boot for the application framework.
Implemented aggressive retry logic for RabbitMQ.
google_docs.bug_mentions: Several discussions revolved around the importance of handling RabbitMQ connection failures and the need to Implement aggressive retry logic.
